organic_results.title: Public and Catholic Schools: A Reanalysis of" Public and Private Schools"
organic_results.snippet: In this study we reanalyze the impact of Catholic school attendance on the reading and mathematics achievement of senior and sophomore pupils using the same data base employed by Coleman, Hoffer and Kilgore in their report," Public and Private Schools." We identify four variables they did not control for--sex, handicap status, region of residence, and eighth grade college attendance expectations--that could be associated with self-selection into Catholic schools, and hence responsible for the apparent significant impact of Catholic …

publication_info.summary: J Noell - Sociology of education, 1982 - JSTOR
